column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Rakiura Track
#Text=The Rakiura Track is a tramping ( hiking ) track in the Rakiura National Park on Stewart Island , off the south of the South Island of New Zealand .
#Text=It is a loop track that starts and finishes near Oban , Stewart Island 's main settlement , and is usually walked in three days .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The Rakiura track is 32km long , but the complete route to and from the village of Oban is 39km including sections on the road at either end .
#Text=Entry to the track is at sea level , and the highest point is approximately 200m .
#Text=The track may be walked in either direction and forms a circular route from Oban , where there are ferries and flights from near Invercargill .
#Text=The track is normally walked in three days , but if you can keep up a good pace , can be done in 2 days or 1 long day in summer .
#Text=The track is also very suitable for day walks .
#Text=A water taxi is available from Oban to Port William .
#Text=This allows either the first day to be done in reverse as a day walk , or the route for days 2 & 3 to be done as a longer day walk .
#Text=The day 1 route is probably the most interesting to do as a day , as there are good coastal views and some beach sections .
#Text=The track has two huts and three campsites , which must be booked in advance with the Department of Conservation .
#Text=The huts have bunks and mattresses ( 24 each ) , toilets , heating and cold running water .
#Text=They do not provide cooking facilities , cooking utensils , linen , showers or toilet paper .
#Text=The campsites have toilets , sinks , cooking shelters and a water supply .
#Text=You need to take all your sleeping gear , food , cooking and eating gear ( eg , portable stove ) , lighting ( torch or candles ) , rubbish bag and toilet paper .
#Text=You will also want wet-weather gear and insect repellent .
#Text=There are several places to stay in and around Oban before or after the hike ; these are best booked in advance .
#Text=Prepare
#Text=Rakiura National Park Visitor Centre , 15 Main Road , Stewart Island , ☏ +6432190009 , ✉ stewartisland@doc.govt.nz .
#Text=M - F 8:30am – 4:30pm , Sa - Su 10am – 2pm .
#Text=Department of Conservation ( DOC ) office in Oban , with a small exhibition and information counter , where you can make late hut bookings .
#Text=Transport
#Text=If you do n't want to walk between Oban and the track ends , you can arrange a shuttle .
#Text=See the Outdoor Adventure Shop at 14 Main Rd or Oban Visitor Centre in the Red Shed at 12 Elgin Terr near the wharf .
#Text=Walk
#Text=The route described here goes anti-clockwise around the track .
#Text=This means that you have the longest road section of route at the start .
#Text=Oban to
#Text=5km
#Text=From the centre of Oban
#Text=follow Horseshoe Bay Road up over a small hill to Horseshoe Bay beach .
#Text=As an alternative there is a track around the coast Horseshoe Point Track , but this is a bit of detour .
#Text=Then walk along ( or around ) the beach and take Lee Bay Road at the far end of the bay .
#Text=The official start of the track is by the beach at Lee Bay .
#Text=Lee Bay to
#Text=8.1km
#Text=The track follows the coast to Magnetic Bay .
#Text=Here the route turns inland , but Port William hut is a small diversion to the north at the other end of the beach .
#Text=There are two parts of this route which use the beach , with inland alternatives at high tide .
#Text=It might be better to time your walk for low tide .
#Text=The first km is an easy section ( there are even a couple of wooden benches ) to Little River .
#Text=As a day walk you could head back from here over Garden Mound .
#Text=The track then crosses Little River on a wooden footbridge and along the beach for about 300m .
#Text=After this there is a brief climb and the path goes through the forest for 2km with occasional glimpses of the sea .
#Text=The track then descends to Maori Beach .
#Text=The first part has an inland alternative , and the paths rejoin at the campsite .
#Text=The historic sawmill ( on the high tide route ) is an interesting diversion 5 minutes back from the beach .
#Text=The track then goes along the length of the beach to a suspension bridge over an inlet at the far end .
#Text=Port William Hut to
#Text=13km
#Text=This section is inland through lush forest .
#Text=North Arm Hut to
#Text=11km
#Text=This section loosely follows the coast of the Paterson Inlet to the main road near the airstrip .
#Text=Fern Gully to Oban
#Text=2km
#Text=It is then a short walk on Main Road down to Half Moon Bay .
#Text=There is a picnic table at the end of the track/ start of the road for you to enjoy a celebratory drink or bar of chocolate .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Ensure you follow the precautions outlined on the Department of Conservation brochures and any other information provided to you .
#Text=Go next
#Text=The North West Circuit Track is a longer , more rugged 10-day hike around Stewart Island , with smaller huts .
#Text=The first day and last day are the same as for the Rakiura Track .
#Text=This route can be extended by including the Southern Circuit .
#Text=Milford Track on the South Island
#Text=Routeburn Track on the South Island
#Text=For other tracks , see Tramping in New Zealand .
